edu.ncsu.csc216.movie_inventory

Class MovieInventoryUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.movie_inventory.MovieInventoryUI

  • public class MovieInventoryUI
extends java.lang.Object
    The MovieInventoryUI class is responsible for processing user input, creating Movie objects, and storing them in MovieInventory.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sarah Heckman (sarah_heckman@ncsu.edu), Chris Bollinger (cwbollin@ncsu.edu)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MovieInventoryUI()
      Constructs a MovieInventoryUI object that contains a MovieInventory and a Scanner for reading console input.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void displayInventory()
      Lists all movies present in this MovieInventory object, along with any empty slots in storage.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Starts the MovieInventory program, initializes MovieInventoryUI and starts the UI loop.
      void promptForMovie()
      UI functionality for adding a Movie.
      java.lang.String promptForMovieRemoval()
      Prompts the user for the name of a Movie.
      void userInterface()
      Controls the looping of the user interface.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MovieInventoryUI

        public MovieInventoryUI()
        Constructs a MovieInventoryUI object that contains a MovieInventory and a Scanner for reading console input.

    • Method Detail

      • userInterface

        public void userInterface()
        Controls the looping of the user interface. and decides which action should take place based on user input.

      • promptForMovie

        public void promptForMovie()
        UI functionality for adding a Movie. Parses user input in the console and attempts to create a Movie object using this information. If successfully created, an attempt is made to add the Movie to inventory. This will occur if there is available space and a duplicate Movie is not already present.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a release date earlier than 1880 is entered.

      • promptForMovieRemoval

        public java.lang.String promptForMovieRemoval()
        Prompts the user for the name of a Movie.
        Returns:
        The name of the Movie to be removed from MovieInventory.

      • displayInventory

        public void displayInventory()
        Lists all movies present in this MovieInventory object, along with any empty slots in storage.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Starts the MovieInventory program, initializes MovieInventoryUI and starts the UI loop.
        Parameters:
        args - command line args
